One of the standout dishes I tried was the traditional Thai red curry. The curry was rich and creamy, with just the right amount of spice, making it a perfect comfort food. Another highlight was the vegan stirfry rice noodles, which, despite an initial hiccup with the ingredients, was delicious and wellseasoned. The restaurant also offers a dedicated section for vegan and vegetarian options, which is a thoughtful touch for those with dietary preferences. The service at FOOD UNIVERSE was impeccable. The staff were friendly, efficient, and more than willing to accommodate special requests. There were a few mentions of occasional inconsistencies with some dishes, but overall, the reviews have been overwhelmingly positive, highlighting the restaurant' s ability to cater to a variety of tastes and dietary needs. Overall, my experience at FOOD UNIVERSE Thai International Cuisine was exceptional. The combination of great food, excellent service, and a comfortable dining environment makes it a mustvisit spot in Bangkok. If you find yourself near BTS On Nut, I highly recommend stopping by FOOD UNIVERSE for a memorable dining experience. You won' t be disappointed.

The banchan was very delicious, we especially loved the japchae and kimchi. The cheesewrapped beef in the end is also a delight, but a very rich mouthful! We ordered tteokbokki and it was also very tasty, with a nice seafood taste. The whole process is so smooth the meat is cooked to your liking by the staff, and the banchan refilled without asking. They dont take reservations and Id imagine it gets pretty busy on the weekends, but we went on a Monday around 6 and didnt have any issues. Better than any Korean BBQ Ive had in London, Singapore, and Toronto, so if youre in Bangkok and want Korean BBQ this is a must!

The salted egg squid deserves special mention instead of the crumbly or creamy versions often encountered elsewhere, this version has the salted egg prepared into a smooth, tart and savoury sauce that is very appetising and not overly rich. Definitely will definitely come back!
This is a very old ThaiChinese restaurant that serves homestyled dishes. Mr Saksun, the current proprietor' s grandfather started the business about 100 years ago after arriving in Thailand from Hainan by boat. It is open everyday but only during lunch and dinner hours only, not the whole day. There are two sitting areas, the front section is non air conditioned and back section is air conditioned. Prices of food are the same, irrespective of where we sit. The taste of the food is authentically delicious and reminds us of homecooked food. Service is fast. Prices are very reasonable too. A very recommendable place.

Well balanced with a touch of sourness. also the deep fried beef and razor clams are excellent. The place has a beautiful old style front room with fan and a back room with AC. If youre looking for an authentic dining experience in Bangkok with absolutely delicious homecooked dishes, you have to stop by Mit Ko Yuan. They serve the kind of ChineseThai cuisine that locals with Chinese ancestry would eat on a daily basis. Most of the dishes have been on the menu for years and the recipes have stayed the same. Their dishes are simple and absolutely delicious. Super affordable. Very causal. A great option for casual lunch or dinner in the old town area. My favorite dishes are their stirfried morning glory and Tom Yum Kung. Im Thai and I can tell you that the way they do it here is the way we cook at home!

리뷰:
The best food ever! ! I have been multiple times to this wonderful restaurant and can honestly say it is the best food around for miles. Ive never had a bad meal. The staff are all wonderful and so friendly! Highly recommend to anyone looking for top quality, authentic food in Thailand.
The food is amazing, among the things I ate here I must say that the Tom yum was one of the best I had here in Thailand. Staff is friendly and nice. They could improve the bathroom tho.
A good restaurant a combination between Thai and Indian kitchen. The food was tasty and well seasoned. The papaya salad was little bit to spicy to our taste. The stir fry vegetables with cashews were amazing. The panang curry with shrimps was also great. The chicken curry was also nice. Overall a great experience.
This little street food location is absolutely what you were looking for. After landing in Bangkok and leaving the hotel for the first time we found this little kiosk that serves typical Thai food. The shrimp pad Thai is breathtaking and the sweet and sour chicken keeps the pace well. Location is immersed in a very local set and service is nice.
A decent restaurant if youre looking to try some very unique and interesting flavors as well as some of the most popular dishes from Thailand and India for very decent prices. Very tasty food available for dine in or takeout. Seafood was tasty but a little overcooked. The pad thai was a little mushy but the taste was good. Cold Indian tee was delicious. Friendly, fast and efficient service. Available also in Thai and English. Payments accepted with cash or card. Reservations not needed even on weekdays during busy season. Handicap friendly and wheelchair accessible. Parking is safe and easy nearby. Printed menu. Vegetarian options available. Restrooms nearby on site. Indoor and outdoor seating.

If you' re in Bangkok and looking for an unforgettable meal, So Samsen is the place to be. It' s a hidden gem that deserves all the recognition and more. I highly recommend it to anyone craving authentic Thai flavors. Your taste buds will thank you!
Super great people, very nice and polite, great food and atmosphere, ok prices. We will come again when we come back in Bangkok
The foods are delicious! ! The drinks are strong and tasty! ! Services are beyond standard, staff are friendly and very helpful. The Lady owner is very kind
Love the decoration, would look great at a beach. Had the banana blossom salad and the green curry. Both were excellent. They have a good menu that covers a bit more than the standard tourist fare.

리뷰:
I decided to eat here as this place was near my hotel and it seemed to be always full of people. I value a good meal and it didnt disappoint. My Pad Thai was delicious, the portion was big and the price was very fair! Many traditional Thai food options. I would come again, great local eatery option if you are in the area
The restaurant has received good ratings, partly due to a promotion where customers are offered free mango sticky rice in exchange for reviews. Additionally, many of the positive ratings seem to come from Western customers who may not be familiar with authentic Asian or Thai cuisine, leading them to perceive the food as excellent.
Remember when food used to be uncomplicated and simply delicious and fresh without the pressure of having to be social media worthy?
Well, here you have it. I have been so tired of eating out and I came across this place late at night after watching Muay Thai fights. I was a bit skeptical due to being in a calm dark alley, but Im glad I trusted the reviews. I had young coconut milk smoothie, chicken satay and papaya salad. Everything was delicious. The smoothie took me by surprise, I didnt expect to like it this much.
Give it a try they also have English translation on their menus a huge plus for me. Only negative is no AC. But they have plenty of fans on.
The food came out quicker than expected, I would say within 5 mins for the spring rolls we had and 10 for the pad Thai! Absolutely lovely staff and the mango shake was delicious. For our first Thai dinner in Bangkok it did not disappoint!
Was close to my hotel and tried it out. It was a great experience. The fried chicken was absolutely delicious, red curry was very fragrant and not too spicy as well. Recommended to all.

Onkijung offers a cozy atmosphere, making it a great spot for a casual dining experience. The food and drink were normal, nothing particularly outstanding, but the Korean BBQ jeongchan for two people stood out as a highlight. If you' re in the mood for a laidback evening of Korean BBQ, Onkijung is worth a visit for its inviting ambiance and flavorful signature dish.
Very good Korean restaurant! Delicious food! Quite spicy for all the dishes. Very polite staffs. The ownermanger comes out to serve the food himself. The limited dishes for 2 people here look amazing! They are super huge, but we did not order.

however, the highlight would be hansang bbq pork set if i remembered its name correctly, which only served for the limit number of set per day.
the set was very good. bbq pork was delicious. the set even came with water and bingo. it was a good refresh after the meal. the place was clean, organized and cozy. the staff was polite, friendly and very helpful the price was very high around 500baht per set, but it came in big proportion.
A modern Korean establishment hidden in the top floors of Central world. They have over 10 branches in Korea and the first one in Thailand. The atmosphere was comforting and casual. A great choice for a fast meal for 24 or even solo. The taste was sharp and refined. The variety the sauces, and the components were fun and enjoyable. The kimchi was the best, not only the taste which incorporate saltiness but also the sesame oil which makes it so appealing. I cant stop eating kimchi here!

One of the best restaurants in Bangkok Ive tried!
For the hot plate oyster omelette, its just so good! The omelette was tender with good smell from onion and white pepper. The oyster was juicy and fresh, the best oyster omelette Ive tried in last 3 years!
The curry crab comes with a lot of sauce, you better order rice to mix with the sauce. Its not spicy at all so you can feel the freshness from the crab! The taste is not heavy, its right amount of softness, definitely want to try again!

The prawn beehoon and river prawns were quite fresh but not our favourite, perhaps due to the different flavour profile. Overall we thought pricing was fair, way cheaper than Singapore for the quality.
Waitress or floor manager helped me pick a meal big enough for 1. Portions very big. Very flavourful and worth the price. The grab curry plus the green chili sauce makes a perfect combo. Would definitely go again. Fish, curry, rice and beer for 33.
Crab meat curry and oyster omlette! !! ! No one will be disappointed with these. Service is a bit like they are tired of all these people coming for their food. Like ok but not super happy to have you. Even when the dining hall is half empty. But crab meat curry is worth this grumpy service experience.

Came here because of the Michelin star status. Some of the dishes were excellent, with the star of the show being the papaya salad with blue crab. The shredded pork noodles felt a little bland in comparison but overall this place has a huge array of authentic Thai dishes to choose from at a great price. The noodles with mackerel were also another table favourite. The only downside is food is brought out when ready and placed on the table without being told what it is, so it can get a little confusing trying to workout whose dish is whose. Ill definitely be back to try more from this menu.
Unusual dishes but they tasted so good. Every dish we had was excellent. Very busy but informal. Can see why it is a Michelin guide regular. Price was fair and we tried a lot of food from the menu as it was one of the more interesting ones we came across in Bangkok.
One of the best Somtam I tried in Bangkok. young coconut with shrimp somtam tastes very subtle and spicy. Yet, all the gentle sweetness, sourness, saltiness, unique smell of fish saucenot the funky type are all there! their signature somtam also uses the fermented fish brown color sauce but it literally helps bring your dead appetite back to life! !! Must try the gengsom? was also very spicy and good. Overall, the food is amazingly good. If you are not good with spicy, please ask for level 1 spicy! Michelinawarded shop, though, I was able to have a seat without booking, maybe it was a bit late hours and also shop has many tables.
Mood is very good. especially the sounds of crush nuts and hot peppers made good BGM. There are so many menus with reasonable price.
Papaya salad is must.
Also I loved coconuts icecream which tastes very thick.
I will definitely come back!
One of my favourite restaurants in BKK.
This was my second time visiting, my first being about eight years ago.
Since then they have renovated the restaurant and became apart of the Michelin Guide congratulations team! .
I did not know this before we arrived, so it was very busy.
I asked the host if I could drink a beer outside while we waited, which he said yes and bought it out to me We only had to wait for about thirty minutes before a table was available. The food was delicious!
Our whole fried fish was cooked to perfection and the som tum was great with an awesome amount of chilli. We also loved the crispy porkrice entree and the corn salad this had fish roe in it which was a nice surprise! . The service was great, every staff member was working hard and they were all very nice. The restaurant has great air conditioning, it was extremely clean and good bathrooms. Everytime I am back in Bangkok, I will always visit this restaurant. Aroi mak mak!
Thank you again to the staff for looking after us you are all great
